title: Three ways the universe could end - Venus Keus

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated age of the universe according to the Big Bang theory?

options.label: A
options.text: It will become brighter and more energetic

options.label: B
options.text: It will become dimmer and less energetic

options.label: D
options.text: It will be redshifted to long wavelengths

options.text: It will be destroyed and broken into tiny pieces

title: Don't ask where I'm from, ask where I'm a local - Taiye Selasi

multiple-choice.question: What is the main argument of Taiye Selasi's speech about where she comes from?

options.label: A
options.text: She argues that countries are eternal and singular things.

options.label: B
options.text: She argues that countries are invented and not fixed.

options.label: C
options.text: She argues that national identity is the most important aspect of human experience.

options.label: D
options.text: She argues that locality is the same as nationality.

multiple-choice.question: According to Taiye Selasi, what is the difference between being a national and being a local?

options.label: A
options.text: A national is someone who has a passport, while a local is someone who has a home.

options.label: B
options.text: A national is someone who has a fixed identity, while a local is someone who has multiple identities.

options.label: C
options.text: A national is someone who comes from a country, while a local is someone who comes from a place.

options.label: D
options.text: A national is someone who is restricted by nationality, while a local is someone who is not restricted.

multiple-choice.question: What are the three "R's" that Taiye Selasi proposes as a way to understand where someone is from?
According to Taiye Selasi, what is the problem with asking "Where are you from?"?

options.label: A
options.text: It is too specific and doesn't allow for multiple identities.

options.label: B
options.text: It is too vague and doesn't allow for a clear answer.

options.label: C
options.text: It implies a fixed identity and ignores multiple experiences.

options.label: D
options.text: It is too complicated and doesn't allow for easy conversation.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the World Cup in relation to national identity?

options.label: A
options.text: It represents a unified national team with a single identity.

options.label: B
options.text: It shows that national teams are comprised of multilocal players.

options.label: C
options.text: It highlights the importance of national history and culture.

options.label: D
options.text: It demonstrates the power of national pride.

multiple-choice.question: According to Taiye Selasi, what is the relationship between power and nationality?

options.label: A
options.text: Nationality is a symbol of power and status.

options.label: B
options.text: Nationality is a way to hide one's true identity and power.

options.label: C
options.text: Nationality is a way to assert one's power and influence.

options.label: D
options.text: Nationality is a code for "Why are you here?" and represents power dynamics.

multiple-choice.question: What is the myth of going back to one's country, according to Taiye Selasi?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a myth that one can always return to their country of birth.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a myth that one can always return to their childhood home.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a myth that one can always return to a place that has not changed.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a myth that one can always return to a place that has not changed, but will always change.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of locality in creative writing, according to Taiye Selasi?

options.label: A
options.text: It adds local color and texture to the story.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes the characters less relatable.

options.label: C
options.text: It highlights the importance of national identity.

options.label: D
options.text: It ignores the complexity of human experience.

multiple-choice.question: According to Taiye Selasi, what is the problem with the myth of national identity?

options.label: A
options.text: It ignores the complexity of human experience.

options.label: B
options.text: It places people into mutually exclusive categories.

options.label: C
options.text: It highlights the importance of national history and culture.

options.label: D
options.text: It demonstrates the power of national pride.

multiple-choice.question: What is Taiye Selasi's proposal for a more inclusive and accurate way to understand where someone is from?

options.label: A
options.text: To ask "Where are you from?" and accept the answer.

options.label: B
options.text: To ask "Where are you a local?" and consider the three "R's".

options.label: C
options.text: To ask "What is your nationality?" and ignore other identities.

options.label: D
options.text: To ask "What is your culture?" and ignore other experiences.

title: How do ocean currents work? - Jennifer Verduin

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of surface currents in the open ocean?

options.label: B
options.text: It is the deflection of air and water due to the Earth's rotation, causing ocean currents to form loop-like patterns.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the movement of air and water from high to low pressure.

options.label: D
options.text: It is the warming of ocean water due to the sun's rays.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It provides oxygen to the ocean.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To forecast weather systems and prepare accordingly.

options.label: D
options.text: To understand the movement of ocean water.

options.label: A
options.text: It causes ocean currents to move in a straight line.

options.label: B
options.text: It causes ocean currents to form loop-like patterns.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It causes ocean currents to slow down.
